comment: Well my opponent might be playing a Caro-Kann, but I have news for him...B.D.G

moves: 1. d4 c6 2. Nc3 d5 3. e4 dxe4 4. f3 exf3 5. Nxf3 Bg4 6. h3
comment:
After this move Black can opt to play
the Bishop back, instead he decides to swop off the pieces.

moves: 1. d4 c6 2. Nc3 d5 3. e4 dxe4 4. f3 exf3 5. Nxf3 Bg4 6. h3 Bxf3 7. Qxf3 Qxd4
comment:
Black is now up by 2 pawns, can White recover, yes by developing and
attacking at the same time.

moves: 1. d4 c6 2. Nc3 d5 3. e4 dxe4 4. f3 exf3 5. Nxf3 Bg4 6. h3 Bxf3 7. Qxf3 Qxd4 8. Be3 Qf6 9. Qg3
comment: Black would love to swop off the Queen's, but that is not my poison.

moves: 1. d4 c6 2. Nc3 d5 3. e4 dxe4 4. f3 exf3 5. Nxf3 Bg4 6. h3 Bxf3 7. Qxf3 Qxd4 8. Be3 Qf6 9. Qg3 e5 10. O-O-O
comment:
White has now reached a safe castled position, and has much more
artillery at his disposal.

moves: 1. d4 c6 2. Nc3 d5 3. e4 dxe4 4. f3 exf3 5. Nxf3 Bg4 6. h3 Bxf3 7. Qxf3 Qxd4 8. Be3 Qf6 9. Qg3 e5 10. O-O-O Nd7 11. Bc4
comment:
Eyeing up the weak f7 square,
the Rook on h1 will come to f1 and further embarace the black Queen.

moves: 1. d4 c6 2. Nc3 d5 3. e4 dxe4 4. f3 exf3 5. Nxf3 Bg4 6. h3 Bxf3 7. Qxf3 Qxd4 8. Be3 Qf6 9. Qg3 e5 10. O-O-O Nd7 11. Bc4 Nh6 12. Rhf1 Qg6
comment:
This time I will oblige Black with the Queen swop, and then hack
away the remnants of the defence.

moves: 1. d4 c6 2. Nc3 d5 3. e4 dxe4 4. f3 exf3 5. Nxf3 Bg4 6. h3 Bxf3 7. Qxf3 Qxd4 8. Be3 Qf6 9. Qg3 e5 10. O-O-O Nd7 11. Bc4 Nh6 12. Rhf1 Qg6 13. Qxg6 fxg6 14. Bxh6 gxh6 15. Ne4
comment:
Now it starts to get very messy, the Knight on d7 is very vunerable now.
Black is still 2 pawns up, but the Bishop to e6 is too strong.

moves: 1. d4 c6 2. Nc3 d5 3. e4 dxe4 4. f3 exf3 5. Nxf3 Bg4 6. h3 Bxf3 7. Qxf3 Qxd4 8. Be3 Qf6 9. Qg3 e5 10. O-O-O Nd7 11. Bc4 Nh6 12. Rhf1 Qg6 13. Qxg6 fxg6 14. Bxh6 gxh6 15. Ne4 O-O-O 16. Be6
comment:
Followed by Knight to f6 Black will lose the piece or drop the pawns
on h7,h6 and g6.

moves: 1. d4 c6 2. Nc3 d5 3. e4 dxe4 4. f3 exf3 5. Nxf3 Bg4 6. h3 Bxf3 7. Qxf3 Qxd4 8. Be3 Qf6 9. Qg3 e5 10. O-O-O Nd7 11. Bc4 Nh6 12. Rhf1 Qg6 13. Qxg6 fxg6 14. Bxh6 gxh6 15. Ne4 O-O-O 16. Be6 Kc7 17. Rf7 Kb6 18. Rdxd7
comment: Alfred decided enough was enough, and so another bloody victory for the B.D.G.
